title.narrative: Conservation of the Ancient and Medieval Collections of the Department of Archaeology of Sri Lanka

description.narrative: To support the conservation of ancient and medieval materials in the Department of Archaeology of Sri Lanka in Colombo. The Department has a vast collection of materials of metal, stone, glass, wood, and other material, the conservation of which poses challenges in a country with few training opportunities. The project includes a collection needs assessment, conservation facility upgrades, and training workshops for department staff.

title.narrative: Building an Effective Trafficking-in-Persons Data and Information Collection and Reporting System in Sri Lanka

description.narrative: This project creates a formal trafficking-in-persons (TIP) data collection and reporting mechanism; train key TIP stakeholders on the mechanism, including criminal justice, government, and non-governmental actors; and disseminate information on the new system to appropriate stakeholders. The Asia Foundation works with the Nielsen Company and Women and Media Collective and partner with the National Anti-Human Trafficking Task Force (NAHTTF) under the Sri Lankan Ministry of Justice.

title.narrative: ENHANCED MECHANISMS FOR THE PROVISION OF PROTECTION AND ASSISTANCE FOR VICTIMS OF TRAFFICKING IN SRI LANKA

description.narrative: This project will look to sustain the efforts of the National Anti-Human Trafficking Force to increase its capacity to identify victims of trafficking and provide them with appropriate assistance and protection. The government shelter established under a previous J/TIP-funded project will be reinforced through capacity building programs for its staff and resources for its management. The project will also look to train and build the capacity of the Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment (SLBFE) and its staff at overseas missions including labor attaches and other consular staff, the staff of the Department of Labor and Ministry of External Affairs. The project will also develop a victim identification and referral mechanisms for use by the staff of these entities. At present the SLBFE operates short-term shelters in certain labor receiving countries in the Middle East and an overnight shelter close to the Katunayake International Airport for returning Sri Lankan female migrants who have encountered abuse abroad. This project will train and sensitize shelter staff on TIP victim identification techniques and on procedures for providing appropriate assistance and protection services to victims.

person-name.narrative: Jenee Sharon; Wes Aviles; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Strengthening Counter Trafficking

description.narrative: Strengthening Counter-Trafficking Efforts (SCOUT) in Sri Lanka Covers grants (including revenue- sharing), subsidies, gratuities, and other aid for which cash payments are made to states, other political subdivisions, corporations, associations, and individuals; contributions to international societies, commissions, proceedings, or projects, whether in lump sum or as quotas of expenses; contributions fixed by treaty; grants to foreign countries; taxes imposed by taxing authorities where the Federal Government has consented to taxation (excluding the employers share of Federal Insurance Contribution Act taxes); and payments in lieu of taxes. Includes readjustment and other benefits for veterans, other than indemnities for death or disability.

title.narrative: Conservation of Ancient Monuments within the Rajagala Archaeological Reserve in the Ampara District of Eastern Sri Lanka, Phase 2

description.narrative: The reserve includes remains of several ancient buildings and monuments that once formed part of Grikumbhila, a large Buddhist monastery active from its foundation in the 2nd century BCE through the early 13th century. This project continues work begun under a previous grant to conserve the site.
